result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher P Glodowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Glodowski to 5  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to any other sentence.

**Per 11/27/17 Order: The sentence in this case is modified to 3 years and 9 months imprisonment, comprised of 3 years of initial confinement and 9 months of extended supervision.**

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay subpoena fees of $222 

--to pay costs and surcharges

--no unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18, with the exception of Isaac Glodowski and Lilly Glodowski 

--to maintain absolute sobriety 

--no possession of any pornographic and/or sexually explicit material 

--no possession or use of a computer or any technological device with Internet capabilities without prior permission from the Agent 

**Per Court's 7/6/20 Order and Amendment to the Judgment of Conviction: The condition of "Mr. Glodowski is not to have unsupervised contact with Isaac Glodowski and Lily Glodowski without his agent's approval" IS VACATED.**

--compliance with the Sex Offender Registration Program 

--compliance with DNA testing 

--to cooperate, attend and participate in all treatment programs recommended by the Agent, including Sex Offender Treatment 

--to cooperate, attend and participate in any AODA treatment deemed necessary 

Arresting Agency: DCI

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

supervisions.notes: **Per 11/27/17 Order: The sentence in this case is modified to 3 years and 9 months imprisonment, comprised of 3 years of initial confinement and 9 months of extended supervision.**

[MK] case called at 1:32pm. 
Defendant Christopher P Glodowski in court with Attorney Patrick K Cafferty.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court verifies with counsel that they have received the Pre-Sentence Investigation Report. 
The Court verifies with Attorney Cafferty that Mr. Glodowski was advised and understood the minimum penalties involved with this conviction at the time of Mr. Glodowski's entry of change-of-plea.   
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.  

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Glodowski to 5  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to any other sentence.

The Court finds that Mr. Glodowski is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Glodowski is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18, with the exception of Isaac Glodowski and Lilly Glodowski 
--compliance with the Sex Offender Registration Program 
--compliance with DNA testing 
--to cooperate, attend and participate in all treatment programs recommended by the Agent, including Sex Offender Treatment 
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--to cooperate, attend and participate in any AODA treatment deemed necessary 
--no possession of any pornographic and/or sexually explicit material 
--no possession or use of a computer or any technological device with Internet capabilities without prior permission from the Agent 
--to pay subpoena fees of $222 
--to pay costs and surcharges 


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 2:02pm.
Sentencing Letter submitted by Attorney Cafferty

[MK] case called at 3:00pm. 
Defendant Christopher P Glodowski in court.  Defense Counsel, Attorney Jillian J Scheidegger, appears by telephone.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.  
The Court notes that a Petition for Review pends; this is a permissive appeal.
Attorney Scheidegger indicates that the Defense has filed a Motion with the Court of Appeals for stay of the proceedings in the Circuit Court, however no response to this has been received yet. 
The Court schedules the case for trial anew.   
Counsel agree that a three day trial setting is needed.  
The Court issues its written Scheduling Order, directing the clerk to mail the Defense copy to the attorney. 
recess 3:12pm.

Defendant Christopher P Glodowski in court with Attorney Jillian Scheidegger on behalf of Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Scheidegger advises that the Court of Appeals has not responded to the Petition for Leave to Appeal. All documents have been received by 
Court reviews that the Court has another case that takes precedent over this case, the Court will remove this case from the trial calendar and will set for a Status Conference.

filed with the Court of Appeals by the Defense
Defendant's Motion to Stay Circuit Court Proceedings Pending the Defendant's Petition for Leave to Appeal - filed with the Court of Appeals
It is hereby Ordered that Defendant's Motion to Suppress Statements allegedly made by Christopher Glodowski to law enforcement officers on August 26, 2015 is denied.

It is Hereby Ordered that Defendant's Motion to Suppress all evidence obtained as a result of the search warrant authorized on AUgust 24, 2015 on grounds that probable cause did not exist to issue the search warrant is denied.

It is hereby Ordered that Defendant's Motion for the Court to make the determination that Wis. Stat. 939.617(2) allows the Court to impose a sentence of less than three years in prison, and to find that 939.617(2) violates Defedant's due process right to "fair warning" notice of criminal penalties and is therefore unconstitutional is denied.

Continuation of 7/19/16 Motion Hearing: 
[MK] case called at 3:37pm. 
Defendant Christopher P Glodowski in court with Attorney Patrick K Cafferty and Attorney Jillian Scheidegger.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel indicate they do not have further evidence to present on the Motions. 
The Evidence is closed. 

The Court finds that no violation under Franks-Mann occurred; probable cause already existed that the computer was still at the residence and if there, the computer would still contain the images. 

As to the statutory construction issue:  the Court concludes, as it relates to the Defense argument that the Statute is unconstitutional in its face or application, that it is otherwise.  The Court finds the Statute is not ambiguous. The reading of the Statute is clear on its face, therefore there is no constitutional challenge that can be appropriately made.  This Defense Motion is denied.  

After hearing arguments on Miranda at the time Mr. Glodowski made his statements, and on voluntariness,  the Court concludes that there has not been a violation of Miranda nor a lack of voluntariness in the Defendant's statements.   

Attorney Cafferty indicates that the Defense will seek interlocutory relief on the statutory-constitutional issue.  
The Court denies the request for a stay for this interlocutory relief pursuit.  
recess 4:31pm.  


NEXT:  the 8/8/16 FSSC and 8/10/16 commencement of the Jury Trial remain on the Court's calendar

In response to Attorney Caffery's inquiry, the Court confirms that Attorney Cafferty should elicit any sought testimony today regarding the Franks-Mann issue raised on the "Tumblr Account" information.

Case called at 11:19am [mo]
Defendant Christopher P Glodowski in court with Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Mr.Glodowski waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on all counts 
No Demand for Speedy Trial at this time

Atty. Cafferty motions for bond modification as to the computer use for work purposes. 
--no objection so long as it is at work and for work purposes only

The Court makes an exception to the bond that Mr. Glodowski may use a computer at Eaton Corporation while at work and only for purposes that are authorized by the employer.

Atty. Cafferty motions for a bond modification as to physical contact with his children
--ADA Hall raises hesitation

The Court modifies Mr. Glodowski's bond to allow supervised contact with his child and child of his significant other, the Court allows the children's mother, Ms. Meagan Montiel, to supervise this contact.
The Court allows the supervisor to be who ever Ms. Montiel would allow to supervise Mr. Glodowski.
recess: 11:40am

Case called at 1:34-pm. [mo]
[Commissioner Onheiber presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Christopher P Glodowski appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jillian Scheidegger on behalf of attorney of record Patrick Cafferty. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Bond arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $1,500 CASH bond, with conditions:
--no physical contact with any child
--not to use or possess any computerized device capable of accessing the Internet
--not to use the Internet or any computerized communication system or network

Speedy Preliminary Hearing demanded by the Defense
